text:
D:\tmp\d>ant
Buildfile: D:\tmp\d\build.xml

t1:
     [echo] t1

t2:
     [echo] t2

t3:
     [echo] t3

test:

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 0 seconds
D:\tmp\d>ant -version
Apache Ant version 1.8.0 compiled on February 1 2010
D:\tmp\d>type build.xml
<project name="test" default="test">

        <target name="t1">
                <echo>t1</echo>
        </target>
        <target name="t2">
                <echo>t2</echo>
        </target>
        <target name="t3">
                <echo>t3</echo>
        </target>

        <!-- Expected: t1, t2, t3, t1 shown -->
        <target name="test" depends="t1,t2,t3,t1">
        </target>

</project>

D:\tmp\d>
creator: alv131@yahoo.com

text:
The 'depends' ensures that the given target is executed.
It does neither ensure the order nor multiple executions of a target.

Example: other order
Add a dependency from t1 to t2 in your example <target name="t1" depnds="t2"> and t2 is executed first.
creator: jan@materne.de
